review.title: “Great place to work, intern”
review.pros: Pros – - highly motivated, intelligent staff- competent, motivated management- good work/life balance- refreshingly optimistic, friendly, and supportive organizational culture- good business model with large potential for expansion- competitive pay
review.cons: Cons – - very small firm, difficult to find open positions or move up
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work!

review.title: “Smart people, poorly managed”
review.pros: Pros – It's not very hierarchical, there is a lot of room for upward mobility and access to high level clients.
review.cons: Cons – Managers etc. say some sexist things
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – HR should maybe look into the sexual harassment/sexist issues

review.title: “Potential to be great, but not if things remain the same.”
review.pros: Pros – -Great staff who are well educated and passionate for what they do-Office located in the heart of DC-Interesting and challenging projects-Flexibility as a consultant
review.cons: Cons – -Very small firm-Little room for professional growth-Revolving door-Favoritism by higher management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – -Higher management should refrain from bad mouthing other consulting firms to employees all the time. This is not professional and comes off as arrogant.-Value your employees. They work hard, often working long hours and over the weekend because they care about the good of the company. Show some gratitude. It is sad to see such a revolving door of such great people come and go through the company. If you treat your professionals better, they will likely stay.-Stop with the favoritism - again, this is not professional. It is very obvious in such a small firm.
